segments.content: This article was motivated by the discovery of a potential new foundation for mainstream mathematics. The goals are to clarify the relationships between primitives, foundations, and deductive practice. We also get clues as to how a foundation can be optimized for effective human use.

foundations are a way to analyze the body of practice, particularly its consistency. A foundation is consistent if every chain of deductions that produces a contradiction can be shown to have a logical error.
By 1900 quite a few mathematicians had found naïve set theory to be effective and reliable. The standard forms of the axioms up to this point are mainly due to zermillo.

Relaxed set theory is uniquely qualified to be a foundation consistent with mainstream mathematical practice. The key ingredients are binary functions: functions to an object generator with exactly two objects. The "=" operator built into the logic of naïve and zfc allows comparison of any two elements of anytwo sets.
